q1 <- " **Which of the following sentences is TRUE?**"
q1_choices <- c(answer= "An underwriter is an investment bank that manages the IPO process and helps the company sell its stock.", 
                "An initial public offering (IPO) is not necessarily the first time a company sells its stock to the public.", 
                "Underwriters face no risk during an IPO, so that a greenshoe provision is usually not necessary.")

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

# Create a data frame with sentences and their truth values
sentences <- c(
  "An underwriter is an investment bank that manages the IPO process and helps the company sell its stock.",
  "An initial public offering (IPO) is not necessarily the first time a company sells its stock to the public.",
  "Underwriters face no risk during an IPO, so that a greenshoe provision is usually not necessary.",
  "A seasoned equity offering (SEO) is the sale of stock by a company that is already publicly traded.",
  "A cash offer occurs when new shares are offered only to existing shareholders.",
  "A rights offer occurs when new shares are sold to investors at large.",
  "The stock price reaction to an SEO is positive on average.",
  "New issues are highly cyclical.",
  "The transaction costs of an IPO are usually low.",
  "IPOs are underpriced on average."
)

truth_values <- c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE)

df <- data.frame(sentence = sentences, truth_value = truth_values)

# Shuffle the rows of the data frame
df <- df[sample(nrow(df)), ]

# Display the randomized sentences with corresponding truth values
cat(fitb("T", num = FALSE, ignore_case = TRUE), df$sentence, "\n\n")
```
